solution.text:
volume of hemispherical metallic toy=volume of the cone
Now volume of the hemisphere\(=\frac 23 [\pi \times R^3]\) radius of the cone=\(_{{2*j}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac 23 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{{2*j}}_^3\)
volume of the cone\(=[ \frac 13 \times \pi \times r^2 \times height]\)
let the height of the cone = \(h \)
volume of the cone\(=[ \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times h]\)
Now the volume of the hemispherical toy = Volume of the cone
\([ \frac 13 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times h]=\frac 23 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{{2*j}}_^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h=_{{16*j}}_\)

content.text:
A metallic toy in the shape of a hemisphere is recast into the shape of a right circular cone.
If radius of the cone(r) is _{j}_ cm and radius of the hemisphere(R) is _{{2*j}}_ cm , find the height of the cone
